1123248689827459072.text: 17/ Thanks to a recent wave of liquidity innovations, including Liquid Tokens & Bonding Curves (https://ban.cr/BondingCurves  - cc @simondlr), the world of programmable value is unfolding before us as tokens move beyond speculation & into everyday consumer applications.

1123248688212709378.text: 16/ Or, one could imagine a social network where any user or group of users can create their own Liquid Token which rises in value as other users purchase it, and is instantly interchangeable for other tokens in the network and beyond.

1123248686396575744.text: 15/ What becomes possible with Liquid Tokens? A user may create a Liquid Token that mimics the price stability of a Top-100 traded token, despite it having significantly less volume and a relatively small amount of tokens in its reserve pool.

1123248684764889088.text: 14/ The ability to set any fixed (and in the future, dynamic) reserve ratio for a Liquid Token allows for flexibility in terms of experimenting with various liquidity models.

1123248683368230912.text: 13/ Any token can be used as a Liquid Token’s collateral. When Relays/Liquid Tokens hold the same token in 1 of their reserves they become convertible for 1 another. Eg, Liquid Tokens holding BNT in their reserve are convertible for tokens on Bancor:https://ban.cr/UtilityOfBNT

1123248681677934594.text: 12/ A Liquid Token, on the other hand, is a mechanism for creating new, instantly liquid tokens with dynamic supply. A Liquid Token determines its price by measuring its total value against one reserve (its collateral), and can be configured to maintain *any reserve ratio*.

1123248679962468352.text:
11/ Comparing Bancor Relays v. Liquid Tokens, a Relay is designed for existing tokens & determines prices by balancing 2 token reserves in its smart contract & maintaining a 50% reserve ratio btwn the 2 token reserves.

Learn more about Bancor Relays:https://hackernoon.com/how-bancor-relays-work-c712a374374f …

1123248677458522112.text: 10/ This table shows how different Reserve Pool Sizes, Reserve Ratios & Conversion Amounts affect the price of a Liquid Token token, the amount received by the user and the price slippage.pic.twitter.com/Bzo4JStRMB

1123248673910075392.text: 9/ These graphs show the price curves of Liquid Tokens with varying Reserve Ratios (RR). The blue area represents the total market cap of each Liquid Token at its current price, while the red area represents the amount of collateral stored.pic.twitter.com/w9VCEdMNgA

1123248672681201664.text:
8/ In general, when a user buys or sells a Liquid Token, 3 variables affect the price they receive:

1. The amount of tokens in the Liquid Token’s reserve pool
2. The Liquid Token’s reserve ratio
3. The amount of Liquid Tokens being bought or sold

1123248670948974592.text: 7/ Liquid Tokens continuously recalculate their price relative to their collateral token by maintaining a fixed ratio btwn the Liquid Token’s total value and the value of its reserve pool. This ratio (the “reserve ratio”) can be used to maintain a Liquid Token's price stability.

1123248669233418241.text: 6/ You’re essentially adding collateral when buying the Liquid Token, and reducing collateral when selling the Liquid Token.

1123247937503539201.text: 5/ A Liquid Token is a smart contract which acts as an automated market maker by regulating the buying and selling of a token along a predetermined price curve, with a single pool of collateral to back it up.

1123245093807431681.text: 4/ Bancor Liquid Tokens offer a solution — allowing anyone to launch a token that is *liquid from day one*. New or niche tokens with low trade volume or small reserve pools need no longer suffer from low liquidity and high volatility .

1123244926140125186.text: 3/ Bancor pioneered pool-based liquidity in 2017. While this invention ensures *constant* liquidity for tokens, offering seamless conversions to users (i.e., low slippage & low volatility) requires funding deep reserve pools — which is often out of reach for new & niche tokens.

1123244704156585985.text: 2/ Token creators turned to for-profit exchanges, paying hefty listing fees to become liquid. But most of these tokens still struggle to gain adoption because the volatility of their token is dependent on the volume of buyers & sellers on an exchange.

1123244560002572288.text: 1/ When @ethereum was born, it promised to allow anyone to launch a token. But this promise quickly faded as many new token creators realized that without *liquidity*, their tokens were not viable, due to large slippage costs & high volatility.

1099683718648774657.text: 11/ As we see more & more tokens emerge to address a widening array of use-cases, the utility of $BNT will continue to grow, as communities utilize the token to plug into the world’s first & largest cross-chain liquidity network.

1099683717293969408.text: 10/ Interoperability between blockchains is one crucial reason why Bancor does not use $ETH, $EOS or any other #blockchain-level token as its hub token. Doing so would restrict the network to only one blockchain, dramatically reducing its reach, flexibility and independence.

1099683715876298752.text: 9/ $BNT is the bridge through which these non-custodial cross-chain conversions can occur, massively increasing its utility.

1099683713804320769.text: 8/ Today, the Bancor Network can perform non-custodial conversions between the @Ethereum and $EOS blockchains. Tomorrow, the Bancor Network may connect any number of #blockchain ecosystems.

1099683712411856896.text: 7/ The utility of $BNT — which operates concurrently on multiple blockchains — becomes increasingly crucial as we accelerate towards a world in which value travels across different #blockchains, such as $ETH, $EOS and $TRON.

1099683710436339712.text: 6/ For instance, a conversion from $DAI to $MKR would convert $DAI for $BNT and then $BNT for $MKR — with the user experience being an instant on-chain conversion from $DAI to $MKR.

1099683709069025280.text: 5/ Using $BNT as a common token in every liquidity pool allows users to perform token-to-token conversions without a counter-party.

1099683707106050049.text: 4/ When a member token joins the Bancor Network, they’re essentially creating an on-chain liquidity pool which holds their token & $BNT in a smart contract.

1099683705415757824.text: 3/ 140+ member tokens are already integrated with the Bancor Network & are all connected through $BNT, allowing instant convertibility between any token in the network and creating 9,500+ conversion pairs.

1099683703838650374.text: 2/ In short, $BNT allows the Bancor Liquidity network to remain #blockchain agnostic and reduces average conversion overhead between tokens as fewer “hops” are required on average.

1099683702488088576.text: 1/ Here’s why $BNT is crucial to the Bancor Liquidity Network:https://ban.cr/UtilityOfBNT

1095308795822198784.text: 8/ $BNT & the Bancor Protocol give developers the ability to build powerful cross-chain services, while users are able to more easily share value between the #dApps they love, no matter the underlying #blockchain they’re built on.

1095308794106654721.text: 7/ Bancor's Liquidity Network was always designed w/ the POV that there will be no "winner takes all" of blockchains. This reality is coming to the fore as an increasing % of user activity occurs across chains & the need for dApps & wallets that function cross-chain rapidly rises

1095308791476834306.text: 6/ Soon, Bancor’s cross-chain conversions will be possible in a single user action from one unified interface:pic.twitter.com/IhhQOm6WSG

1095308790134644736.text: 5/ $BNT — which operates concurrently on multiple chains — is the vessel through which cross-chain transactions occur in the network. In effect, BNT is what makes Bancor a #blockchain-agnostic liquidity network.

1095308788519841792.text: 4/ Today Bancor Network enables conversions between tokens which are built on separate blockchains (@Ethereum, $EOS, $POA, with more to come):https://blog.bancor.network/announcing-bancorx-the-first-cross-blockchain-decentralized-liquidity-network-aebb6a0dad8d …
